intro: Vernonia grantii, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. Its yellow-orange flower heads appear in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Vernonia grantii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
